definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to gasp for breath/to take a breather
to struggle on whilst at death's door (idiom)
to breathe heavily like an ox (idiom)/to huff and puff
variant of 喘吁吁[chuan3 xu1 xu1]

sentences.english: She brought up the water, stopping at each landing to get her breath.
sentences.chinese: 她提水上楼，在每个楼梯平台处停下来喘口气。

sentences.english: ObjectiveTo observe pharmacological effects of Zhenke Zhichuan Tablets.
sentences.chinese: 目的观察镇咳止喘咀嚼片的主要药理作用。

sentences.english: He snorted and then said, “They want to go up north.
sentences.chinese: 他呼哧呼哧喘着气，然后说，“他们想去北边。

sentences.english: Most of the aromatherapy carrier oils you find in grocery stores are not cold-pressed .
sentences.chinese: 大部分的香薰油母你觉得不冷杂货店喘不过气来。

sentences.english: You try to keep all your commitments in your head and feel overwhelmed.
sentences.chinese: 你努力记住自己作出的所有允诺，感到喘不过气。

sentences.english: So crowded is this bus that I can hardly breathe.
sentences.chinese: 车上如此拥挤以至于我几乎喘不动气。

sentences.english: The janitor staggered down the stairway, stunned and gasping.
sentences.chinese: 瞧门人惊呆了，喘着粗气，摇摇摆晃地走下楼梯。

sentences.english: Start small so you won't be overwhelmed.
sentences.chinese: 从小处着手，不会被压的喘不过气来。

sentences.english: We can often become overwhelmed by it all.
sentences.chinese: 经常我们会被这一切压得喘不过起来。

sentences.english: GASP】He gasped for air as he ran from the smoke-filled room.
sentences.chinese: 他喘着气从烟雾弥漫的房间里跑出来。

sentences.english: There was a pause as James caught his breath.
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯顿了一下，喘了口气。

sentences.english: Heave his thick breath, and shake his palsied head.
sentences.chinese: 让他们摇着麻痹的头颅，喘着艰难的呼吸。

sentences.english: That run has puffed me out.
sentences.chinese: 那场赛跑累得我喘不过气来。

sentences.english: As each youngster arrived at the scene, it wasclearly overwhelmed with excitement and nervousness.
sentences.chinese: 每只到场的幼仔，显然都被兴奋和焦躁压得喘不过气。

sentences.english: The dying woman panted out her last wishes .
sentences.chinese: 那个垂死的老妇人喘着气说出了她的遗愿。

sentences.english: If you become winded, slow down.
sentences.chinese: 如果你变得喘不过气，减速。

definition: slow/unhurried/sluggish/gradual/not tense/relaxed/to postpone/to defer/to stall/to stave off/to revive/to recuperate
to get one's breath back/to take a breather
to gasp for breath/to take a breather
sound of sighing/(interjection expressing surprise, sorrow, regret, disappointment etc) oh/damn/wow
one breath/in one breath/at a stretch
tone of voice/the way one speaks/manner of expression/tone
out of breath (idiom)/to gasp for air
pinyin: shang4 qi4 bu4 jie1 xia4 qi4

definition: to breathe/to suck in/to absorb/to inhale
